001package org.biopax.validator.web.controller;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.util.*;
005
006import org.biopax.validator.api.beans.Behavior;
007import org.biopax.validator.api.beans.Category;
008import org.biopax.validator.api.ValidatorUtils;
009import org.biopax.validator.api.Rule;
010import org.biopax.validator.api.Validator;
011import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;
012import org.springframework.core.io.support.PropertiesLoaderUtils;
013import org.springframework.stereotype.Controller;
014import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.ModelAttribute;
015import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestMapping;
016
017
018@Controller
019public class InfoController {
020
021  private Validator validator;
022  private ValidatorUtils utils;
023  private Properties errorTypes;
024  private Set extraDbSynonyms;
025
026  @Autowired
027  public InfoController(Validator biopaxValidator, ValidatorUtils utils, Set extraDbSynonyms)
028    throws IOException
029  {
030    this.validator = biopaxValidator;
031    this.utils = utils;
032    this.errorTypes = PropertiesLoaderUtils.loadAllProperties("codes.properties");
033    this.extraDbSynonyms = extraDbSynonyms;
034  }
035
036  @ModelAttribute("behaviors")
037  public Behavior[] ruleBehaviors() {
038    return Behavior.values();
039  }
040
041  @RequestMapping(value={"rules","rules.html"})
042  public @ModelAttribute("rules") Collection<AboutRule> rules() {
043
044    Set<AboutRule> rules = new TreeSet<>();
045
046    for(Rule r: validator.getRules()) {
047      String name = r.getClass().getName();
048      rules.add(new AboutRule(name, utils.getRuleDescription(name),
049        utils.getRuleBehavior(name, null), utils.getRuleBehavior(name, "notstrict")));
050    }
051
052    return rules;
053  }
054
055  /**
056   * This (DTO) is used in the 'rules' JSP page/view
057   */
058  public static class AboutRule implements Comparable<AboutRule>{
059    private String name;
060    private String tip;
061    private Behavior stdProfile;
062    private Behavior altProfile;
063
064    AboutRule(String name, String tip, Behavior stdProfile, Behavior altProfile) {
065      this.name = name;
066      this.tip = tip;
067      this.stdProfile = stdProfile;
068      this.altProfile = altProfile;
069    }
070
071    public String getName() {
072      return name;
073    }
074    public void setName(String name) {
075      this.name = name;
076    }
077
078    public String getTip() {
079      return tip;
080    }
081    public void setTip(String tip) {
082      this.tip = tip;
083    }
084
085    public Behavior getStdProfile() {
086      return stdProfile;
087    }
088    public void setStdProfile(Behavior stdProfile) {
089      this.stdProfile = stdProfile;
090    }
091
092    public Behavior getAltProfile() {
093      return altProfile;
094    }
095    public void setAltProfile(Behavior altProfile) {
096      this.altProfile = altProfile;
097    }
098
099    public int compareTo(AboutRule r) {return name.compareTo(r.name);};
100  }
101
102  @ModelAttribute("categories")
103  public Category[] errorCategories() {
104    return Category.values();
105  }
106
107  @RequestMapping(value={"errorTypes","errorTypes.html"})
108  public @ModelAttribute("errorTypes") Collection<ErrorCfg> errorTypes() {
109    Map<String, ErrorCfg> map = new HashMap<String, ErrorCfg>();
110    // keys there are as: CODE, CODE.default, CODE.category (CODE is a validation error id)
111    // extract unique error ids -
112    for(Object key : errorTypes.keySet()) {
113      String code = key.toString();
114      if(!code.endsWith(".default") && !code.endsWith(".category")) {
115        map.put(code, new ErrorCfg(code));
116      }
117    }
118
119    // set the rest of error props -
120    for(ErrorCfg cfg : map.values()) {
121      cfg.category = errorTypes.getProperty(cfg.code + ".category", "N/A (default: information)");
122      cfg.defaultMsg = errorTypes.getProperty(cfg.code + ".default", "N/A");
123      cfg.caseMsgTemplate = errorTypes.getProperty(cfg.code, "N/A");
124    }
125
126    return new TreeSet<>(map.values());
127  }
128
129  /**
130   * DTO (for the JSP view)
131   */
132  public static class ErrorCfg implements Comparable<ErrorCfg>{
133    private String code;
134    private String defaultMsg;
135    private String caseMsgTemplate;
136    private String category;
137
138    ErrorCfg(String code) {
139      this.code = code;
140    }
141
142    public int compareTo(ErrorCfg that) {
143      return this.code.compareToIgnoreCase(that.code);
144    }
145
146    public String getCode() {
147      return code;
148    }
149
150    public void setCode(String code) {
151      this.code = code;
152    }
153
154    public String getDefaultMsg() {
155      return defaultMsg;
156    }
157
158    public void setDefaultMsg(String defaultMsg) {
159      this.defaultMsg = defaultMsg;
160    }
161
162    public String getCaseMsgTemplate() {
163      return caseMsgTemplate;
164    }
165
166    public void setCaseMsgTemplate(String caseMsgTemplate) {
167      this.caseMsgTemplate = caseMsgTemplate;
168    }
169
170    public String getCategory() {
171      return category;
172    }
173
174    public void setCategory(String category) {
175      this.category = category;
176    }
177  }
178
179  @ModelAttribute("extraDbSynonyms")
180  public Set extraDbSynonyms() {
181    return extraDbSynonyms;
182  }
183
184  // JSP view knows what to do (uses the MVC model and model attributes)
185  @RequestMapping({"extraCfg","extraCfg.html"})
186  public void extraCfg() {}
187}
